data.title: Multi thread debugging: wrong Paused on Breakpoint label
data.body:
Tests: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29168

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14 test pass
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. C# setup as described in #29168 
2. Set a breakpoint in one of the threads.
3. The UI shows:

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1931590/27580558-40ac1ba6-5b2b-11e7-975b-253a0edc96ef.png)


Although the first two threads are not paused.

data.title: Sublime Extension prompt shown should not be stored in user settings
data.body:
Testing #29144

```
"sublimeTextKeymap.promptV3Features": true
```
This should not be a user-facing setting. Extensions should store state using the `context` object passed into the `activate` function.

Instead, I suggest the following:
* contribute a command called: "Customize VS Code with Sublime Text settings"
* this will ensure that the user can invoke the command palette and invoke the customize action independently of the prompt and repeatedly.
* once user interaction has been made with the prompt (i.e. YES or NO, but not More info), the `context.globalState` passed in the `activate` method should be used to store the flag that the prompt should not be shown again.
  * when `YES` is pressed, invoke the command you have contributed and write to `globalState` that the prompt should not be shown again.
  * when `NO` is pressed, write to `globalState` that the prompt should not be shown again.
  * when `More info` is pressed, open the help page.

For testing purposes, I believe the extension global state can be cleared via Developer Tools > Application > Local Storage

data.title: Sublime Extension wording is weird
data.body:
Testing #29144

I don't think we should hide or mask the fact that the extension writes to user settings.

---

> New features are available for the Sublime Text Keymap 3.0. Do you want to enable the new features?

Perhaps "Would you like to customize VS Code to behave more like Sublime Text?"

---

> Sublime Text Keymap: New features have been added.

Perhaps "User settings have been successfully modified" with a link to "Review user settings".

The error case (e.g. dirty or invalid `settings.json`) should present the error message.

---

> Sublime Text Keymap: New features have not been enable.

Do not show this prompt, unless an error case occurred.

data.title: Sublime Extension does not handle error while writing to user settings
data.body:
Testing #29144

Open your `settings.json` and make a change to the file. Make sure you don't have auto-save enabled and that the file is dirty.

Reload VS Code and wait for the Sublime Extension prompt. Click on `Yes`. The extension shows the message "New features have been added" while in fact it could not write to the user settings.

data.title: Terminal should honour altCmdClick setting
data.body: For the editor you can now configure if cmd or alt click opens a link (`"editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrlCmd"`) and it would be nice the terminal picks that up too. Today, alt+click opens links in the editor and cmd+click open links in the terminal

data.title: [html] Please add native syntax highlighting for 'template/text' logic-less code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an HTML page that uses Mustache to render the DOM (i.e. <script type="template/text" id="template">[DOM content]</script>)
2.  Notice that the code appears as if it were plain text.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14346320/27578111-003150d8-5b1b-11e7-9695-cef1a919e89b.png)

It would be ideal if the code could be hightlighted as if it were html or JavaScript to allow for easier editing.

Thank you.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Enable light update for macOS
Please implement source control status in the File Explorer
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit files within a Git repository
2. Notice that modified files do not change colour to match colour indicators in the code view
3. Without moving to the Source Control panel, it is impossible to identify which files have been modified. It would be great if you could emulate the Git status functionality of Atom, whereby all modified files are highlighted until the changes have been committed (after which, the colour returns to normal).

[Screenshot courtesy of Atom project]
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14346320/27577653-6dae2c0a-5b19-11e7-8b19-70ce0823946d.png)

Although I love the VS Code interface, I feel a little lost without this feature.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Commit options are clickable when there is nothing to commit
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: OS X Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:
1. There is nothing to commit
2. The `Commit Staged` and `Commit All` options in the git ui are still clickable
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

I am downgrading version of VS Code right now, because of this.
Is it a bug, or it is a feature ?

data.title: Option to show emmet suggestions in languages that are not pure mark up or stylesheet like
Closing vscode while a  process is running in the terminal causes the process to stay alive forever
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Mint 17

I created #24688 that apparently has been resolved in April, but unfortunately I still reproduce the same issue.

I am using Tmux 2.3 as my terminal.

Steps to reproduce:
1)Open a project in vscode
2)In the integrated terminal run a non-terminating process (I can reproduce with webpack in watch mode)
3)Close vscode

The process will still be alive.

data.title: Ruler: depending on the size of the file tree, the ruler can be 1px or 2px wide
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Resize the editor/file browser on the left
2. The ruler changes width randomly

This is a mild annoyance but depending on the size of the editor/file tree, the ruler's width will change from 1px to 2px, making it more noticeable than it needs to be on some occasions.

Screenshots to compare:

![screen shot 2017-06-27 at 09 25 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1923346/27575767-113a8714-5b1b-11e7-8cb9-d9835e29ea16.JPG)

data.body:
Hello,

I am a little new to Git and have a query regarding updating my existing project VS Code which i need to push to my Git Repo but I am unable to do that from VS Code editor, I keep getting the message "Your repository has no remotes configured to push to". I have Cloned the Gir Repo but I am not able to sync in both. I have my code staged in my local folder but help me push it to Git Repo. Thanks, Jit


- VSCode Version: 1.13.1

data.title: [json] schema validation should support defining the problem severity

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently all schema problems are flagged as warnings. Would be cool if I can control this and sometimes make them errors.

data.title: Explorer: use files.exclude for filterToAddRemovedOnWorkspacePath
data.body: There is the last remaining `toWorkspaceRelativePath` being used in explorer to filter out events on version control folders. Instead of this hardcoded check I suggest to simply read `files.exclude` and ignore file events from paths that match any of the excludes. Since this check is about updating the explorer it makes sense to ignore file events for paths that are hidden anyways.

data.title: Explorer: show "Folders" as title when in multi root
data.body: Today we show the workspace name it seems.

data.title: Settings: there are more supported settings on a folder scope
data.body:
Noticed that today we only mark editor.* and files.exclude as supported for folders, but we support many more:

* `editor.*`
* `files.trimTrailingWhitespace`
* `files.insertFinalNewLine`
* `files.encoding`
* `files.autoGuessEncoding`
* `files.watcherExclude`
* `search.exclude`

data.title: Integrated terminal converts tab characters to spaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Integrated terminal - spaces:

```
$ node -e "console.log('foo\tbar')"
foo     bar
```

iTerm2 - tab:

```
$ node -e "console.log('foo\tbar')"
foo	bar
```

data.title: Copy-paste selection cutoff from debug-console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Mint 18.1 Cinnamon 64-bit
- Node.js debug

Hello guys. I have found funny bug - when trying to copy-paste debug console output, VS code select just what you see on the screen. If I try to resize debug console it still select just what you see, not the whole output.
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a long array or object
2. Console-logify it.
3. Try copy and paste it from debug console.
![2017-06-27 11-48-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22980660/27571558-d10af050-5b30-11e7-9945-e6cd48192d49.png)
![2017-06-27 11-49-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22980660/27571564-d90fe7ba-5b30-11e7-906c-59caee93300f.png)

data.title: History: files.exclude no longer applies
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a workspace with one folder that contains another folder "qunit" with some files
2. F1 > Clear Editor History
3. open some files from the qunit folder to add them to quick open history
4. Open settings and define a files.exclude like this:

```json
"files.exclude": {
    "**/.git": true,
    "**/.svn": true,
    "**/.hg": true,
    "**/CVS": true,
    "**/.DS_Store": true,
    "**/qunit/**": true
}
```

=> the qunit folder should now hide from the explorer
=> bring up quick open and notice the file from qunit still showing up

This is unexpected, I have code that listens to changes to the `files.exclude` pattern and remove entries that no longer match. When I debug this I end up in this location right before I enter `ParsedExpression` here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.ts#L428

The pattern does not match, but I verified that the setting is the one as defined. It gets created right here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.ts#L127

Is there something wrong with parsing maybe?

@chrmarti I have lost the ability to understand or even debug our glob implementation. Assigning to you in the hope that you have better ways of doing so. I think what we need is a way to log exactly how the matching happens within glob. Today this method is so heavily optimized and complex that I always loose myself in it.

data.title: June endgame
data.body:
## Endgame Schedule
- *June 26*, Code freeze for the endgame
- *July 7*, Endgame done

#### Monday, June 26
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT

#### Tuesday, June 27
- [x] [Test plan items](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A"June+2017") assigned
- [x] [All closed feature-requests either have a verification-needed or on-testplan tag](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=label%3Afeature-request+-label%3Aon-testplan+-label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Aduplicate+milestone%3A%22June+2017%22+is%3Aclosed)
- [x] Testing
- [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)

#### Wednesday, June 28
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the June milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22June+2017%22)

#### Thursday, June 29
- [x] Fixing last issues
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22June+2017%22)
